dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5275 IH: Diagnostic Accuracy in Sepsis Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania (for himself and Ms. Craig) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to include blood contamination as a hospital acquired condition under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Diagnostic Accuracy in Sepsis Act of 2025.

section.header: Including blood contamination as a hospital acquired condition under the Medicare program
section.text: Section 1886(p) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1305ww(p)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking means a condition and inserting the following:
by striking subsection (d)(4)(D)(iv) and any and inserting the following:
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph:
with respect to discharges occurring during fiscal year 2026 or a subsequent fiscal year, blood culture contamination; and

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (7) as paragraph (8); and
by inserting after paragraph (6) the following new paragraph:

In establishing a measure for blood culture contamination for a subsection (d) hospital for purposes of determining whether such hospital is an applicable hospital under paragraph (2), the Secretary shall so establish such a measure on the basis that the rate of such contamination should not exceed 1 percent.
